html.p: The Zero Install system aims to provide a better way of installing software than traditional systems (tarballs, apt-get, bundles, setup.exe, etc). Here are some of our goals:

td.p: You don't have to be root just to install a word-processor.
You don't need to be blessed by a distribution (or anyone else) to be part of Zero Install.

td.h3: It doesn't matter whether software is installed or not
td.p: You just run it. Zero Install handles the rest (downloading and caching as needed).
If one user installs a 20 Mb application, another user can run it without downloading it again.

td.h3: Users don't need to trust each other
td.p: If one user downloads a malicious program, other users aren't affected.
